skill.name: webapp-testing
skill.description: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying frontend functionality, debugging UI behavior, capturing browser screenshots, and viewing browser logs.
skill.summary: Toolkit for interacting with and testing local web applications using Playwright. Supports verifying...

security_audit.summary: This official skill is pre-reviewed and uses standard local automation patterns. No additional security concerns were identified during this minimal audit.

content.value_statement: Manual UI testing is slow and inconsistent for local web apps. This skill runs Playwright scripts, manages dev servers, and captures screenshots and logs.
actual_capabilities: Run Playwright scripts for local web app interactions
Start and stop one or more dev servers before tests
Wait for network idle before UI inspection
Capture full page screenshots during automation
Collect and save browser console logs
Automate static HTML with file URLs
limitations: Requires Playwright and browser binaries to be installed
Targets local URLs and file URLs, not remote environments by default
Example scripts use fixed output paths that may need edits
No built in assertion framework or reporting

use_cases.title: Verify UI changes locally
use_cases.description: Run quick Playwright checks after modifying components to validate interactions and capture screenshots.

use_cases.title: Reproduce console errors
use_cases.description: Capture browser console logs during scripted flows to isolate client side issues.

use_cases.title: Generate UI visuals
use_cases.description: Automate page visits and save consistent screenshots for documentation updates.

prompt_templates.title: Run a basic check
prompt_templates.scenario: Test a local app on port 5173
prompt_templates.prompt: Use this skill to open http://localhost:5173, wait for network idle, click the Login button, and take a screenshot.

prompt_templates.title: Find elements
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Playwright script that lists visible buttons, links, and input fields on http://localhost:5173 and prints their text.

prompt_templates.title: Capture console logs
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a script that navigates to http://localhost:5173, clicks Dashboard, and saves console logs to a file.

prompt_templates.title: Run with servers
prompt_templates.prompt: Use scripts/with_server.py to start backend on 3000 and frontend on 5173, then run a Playwright script that visits the home page.

output_examples.input: Open the local app, wait for load, list the buttons, and take a screenshot.
output: Opened http://localhost:5173 and waited for network idle
Found 3 visible buttons: Save, Cancel, Export

best_practices: Wait for network idle before inspecting dynamic content
Use descriptive selectors like role or text for stability
Close the browser cleanly after automation
anti_patterns: Reading the DOM before the page finishes loading
Using brittle selectors that depend on generated classes
Leaving servers running after automation completes

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: It works where Python and Playwright are available. It targets local servers and file URLs.

faq.question: What are the main limits?
faq.answer: It does not include assertions or reporting by default. You must add checks in your script.

faq.question: How do I integrate it with my dev server?
faq.answer: Use scripts/with_server.py to start servers and run your Playwright command after they are ready.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: All actions run locally. Logs and screenshots are written to local output paths you control.

faq.question: What should I do if the page does not load?
faq.answer: Confirm the server is running and the port is correct. Increase the timeout if startup is slow.

faq.question: How does it compare to other tools?
faq.answer: It provides simple local automation with Playwright. It does not replace full end to end test suites.
